statement:
In this entry, we will prove that the definitions of $C^*$ algebra given
in the main entry are equivalent.

A Banach algebra $A$ with an antilinear involution $*$ such that
${\Vert a\Vert}^2 \leq {\Vert a^* a\Vert}$ for all $a \in A$ is a
$C^*$-algebra.

It follows from the product inequality
${\Vert ab\Vert} \leq {\Vert a\Vert}{\Vert b\Vert}$ that
$${\Vert a\Vert}^2 \leq {\Vert a^* a\Vert} \leq {\Vert a^*\Vert}{\Vert a\Vert}.$$
Therefore, ${\Vert a\Vert} \leq {\Vert a^*\Vert}$. Putting $a^*$ for
$a$, we also have
${\Vert a^*\Vert} \leq {\Vert a^{**}\Vert} = {\Vert a\Vert}$. Thus, the
involution is an isometry: ${\Vert a\Vert} = {\Vert a^*\Vert}$. So now,
$${\Vert a\Vert}^2 \leq {\Vert a^* a\Vert} \leq {\Vert a\Vert}^2.$$
Hence, ${\Vert a^* a\Vert} = {\Vert a\Vert}^2$.

A Banach algebra $A$ with an antilinear involution $*$ such that
${\Vert a^* a\Vert} = {\Vert a^*\Vert}{\Vert a\Vert}$ is a
$C^*$-algebra.
